text.tspan: When 'mitering' offset polygons, the maximum distance
point 'b' can be from point 'a' is set by 'limit' (λ) where λ
is a multiple of delta (δ). Therefore, for any given angle
we need to know if length(ab) > λ * δ.
Find the largest angle ß (or smallest Ø since Ø = π - ß)
for a given limit (λ), expressing ß as sin(ß) or cos(ß) since
these can easily be derived from cross or dot products
Example: if miter limit = 2 (ie 2 times delta) then
Therefore, when ß > 120 deg. (or Ø < 60 deg.), the
distance point 'b' would be from point 'a' would exceed
When to square a mitered join ...
